title: Bug: Strange 'Copy Package'
description: Bug report concerning an issue with the 'Copy Package' functionality in the Eclipse JDT. When performing the following steps: 1. Create a new project named xxx. 2. Open the Package Viewer and select a package in project A. 3. From the context menu, choose the 'Copy' option.  As a result of this action, the package 'ui' is duplicated in the project xxx, even though it should not be.
OB: When copying a package in the Package Viewer, the package 'ui' is duplicated in the project xxx.
EB: The package 'ui' should not be duplicated in the project xxx when copying a package in the Package Viewer.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Create a new project named xxx. 2. Open the Package Viewer and select a package in project A. 3. From the context menu, choose the 'Copy' option.
